meanings.definition: The middle part of a course or journey.
meanings.sent1: During the midcourse of the race, the runners were evenly matched.
meanings.sent2: The hikers took a break at the midcourse of the trail to enjoy the view.
meanings.sent3: At the midcourse of the movie, the unexpected plot twist left everyone in shock.
meanings.sent4: In the midcourse of life, she found a new passion for painting.
meanings.sent5: The midcourse of the river was calm and peaceful, perfect for fishing.

meanings.sent3: His midcourse decision to switch majors surprised his friends but made him happier.
